summary: Armed groups in the Democratic Republic of the Congo continue to commit severe human rights abuses and to profit from the mining and trading of "conflict minerals," according to the State Department. These minerals include tin, gold, and others that are used to finance conflict in the area. State and the U.S. Agency for International Development created a conflict minerals strategy in 2011 to try...
title: Conflict Minerals: Actions Needed to Assess Progress Addressing Armed Groups' Exploitation of Minerals
